images.copyright: Squirrel looking into the lens of a camera (© Alfredo Piedrafita/Getty Images)
images.title: Ready for my close-up
images.caption: World Photography Day
images.desc: On August 19, 1839, French artist and photographer Louis-Jacques-Mandé Daguerre made public his invention that created an image using a silver-plated copper sheet and mercury vapor. The daguerreotype process became the first publicly available photographic process and was used throughout the 1840s and 1850s.
